reviewText: The women of Liberia, in serious of shockingly unknown events, were able to change the face of their nation's government. How? Not with guns. Not with politicians and diplomats. But by employing the ancient Greek techniques of Lysistrata by Aristophanes. Using every technique from sex strikes to striping naked and barricading hallways, the women of Liberia wage a successful campaign to oust their president and resume their country's stalled peace talks.Pray the Devil Back to Hell is sure to inspire anyone who feels they do not have the power to make a change in the world. The women of Liberia united across religious and cultural boundaries in the face of a devastating civil war in order to bring peace to their countries. With these women as examples, no one ever needs to feel they aren't important enough to make a difference. This film has the power to touch hearts and move people to action.Pray the Devil has also spawned the "Peace is Loud" campaign, which everyone should check out after watching the film [...]. It's a great way to move from inspiration to action.

reviewText: Interesting story but presented in a disjointed way that reduced impact.  You could tell it was produced with sincerity, it just didn't seem as compelling as it should have been.
summary: not as good as I hoped it would be
Title: N/A

reviewText: These women had one goal: End the war.  They joined forces (Christian and Muslim) determined that the men that were continuing the total decimation of their community and families.  They set aside religion and community standing to unify.  They battled hard.  They did consistent sit-ins.  They practiced peaceful resistance but made sure they were heard.  They all wore the same white outfits so that they were identical further unifying their purpose.  They even withheld sex from their men to show their sincerity.  These women changed their world!They taught us lessons by their commitment and unity; it is amazing what people can achieve when they work together.This is a lesson for all of us.  Let us not be weary in well doing.If you are looking to be inspired, this film is a must.

reviewText: What a eye opening movie.  It is sad when those in power make such horrible selfish choices. These choices impact a whole area or nation with such a horrific impacting way.  I hope they can find peace and joy in the lives again.

reviewText: This is a great video.  It literally proves that prayer works.  These women are to be commended for their faith and courage.  Christians and Muslims, together praying for the end of a civil war.  If only the women of America could come together and pray.  Just think of it, Muslims, Jews, Christians, Buddhists and countless others.  What we could accomplish!  Pax.

reviewText: We learn this from "Pray the Devil Back to Hell", an outstanding film by Gini Reticker and Abigail Disney that tells the story of a group of Liberian women who use peace tactics to overcome the civil war in their country.The first time I watched this amazing documentary, I knew that it would quickly become one of my favorites. It just shows how non-violent methods can lead to peace and progression. The women in this film prove that people can get together, no matter what religion they are, and fight for change.It's a powerful story that will remain at the top of my favorite films list for a long time to come.
summary: Peace is Loud, and is also attainable.
